headline: Bank of America combines consumer units, promotes top exec
summary: Holly O'Neill, who was No. 5 on American Banker's list of the Most Powerful Women in Banking last year, will oversee a new department combining BofA's retail and preferred units. Aron Levine, who previously led preferred banking, is leaving the company.

headline: Dave: Middle America's Banking Stock
summary: Despite a market cap drop to $1 billion post-SPAC, Dave's revenue grew 38% in 2024, with improved customer credit profiles and reduced delinquency rates. Read more about DAVE stock here.
